_prev_prog_3.Description: The Accidental Release Prevention Program integrates the OSHA Process Safety Management program required under 29 CFR 1910.119 and the additional off-site considerations covered in 40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D, as an Accidental Release Prevention Program.  One of the most important aspects of the prevention program is adherance to the mechanical integrity portion of the PSM Program.  Additionally, a strong emphasis is being placed on employee involvement and training to assisst management with continued developement of the prevention program.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Sorrento Lactalis, Inc. (SLI) produces various cheese products at our facility located in Buffalo, NY.  SLI has a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner.  Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 

SLI takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  SLI also has a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets.  The V.P. of Manufacturing is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?    Employee Participation Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safety Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation Procedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences. 

 

E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 

An Emergency Action Plan (EAP) has been implemented at the facility.  The EAP contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with local fire department officials. 



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

We have identified potential changes to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration system.  All potential changes are documented through meeting notes and/or action lists associated with the PSM/RMP Program.
